meanings.definition: A person who praises or honors someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The glorifier at the ceremony spoke highly of the award recipient.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the school's top glorifier, always cheering on her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The glorifier at the party kept complimenting everyone's outfits.
meanings.sent4: Her role as a glorifier shone brightly in the community, spreading positivity.
meanings.sent5: The young girl was a natural glorifier, making everyone feel special.

meanings.definition: A device or substance that enhances the appearance or attractiveness of something.
meanings.sent1: The makeup artist used a glorifier to make the actor's skin look flawless on camera.
meanings.sent2: The hair product acted as a glorifier, giving her hair a beautiful shine.
meanings.sent3: The new car wax claimed to be the ultimate glorifier for any vehicle.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight acted as a natural glorifier, making the garden look even more vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The decorator used a special paint as a glorifier to brighten up the room.

meanings.definition: To praise or honor someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He would often glorifier his favorite sports team after a big win.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to glorifier the hero who saved the cat from a tree.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would glorifier her cat for catching a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to glorifier the canvas, bringing the painting to life.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would always glorifier her students' hard work in the classroom.
